newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Coffee - Indonesian prices remain on uptrend.
newsitem.headline: Coffee - Indonesian prices remain on uptrend.

text.p: Indonesian coffee prices remained on the uptrend on Monday with farmers still holding back supplies in anticipation of higher prices, local traders said.
"Prices are up again as farmers are still holding back their coffee. They know the supply is already tight," one Jakarta trader said.
Traders said coffee prices in the main growing areas of Lampung and Palembang in Sumatra had risen to between 3,350 and 3,400 rupiah/kg from 3,200 rupiah last week.
Traders said the export price of grade four Robusta remained at about $1,400/tonne.
Traders said foreign buyers had started to switch to Vietnam for coffee because of the high Indonesian prices.
"Foreign buyers have started to switch to Vietnam which has started to sell the commodity. It seems farmers are not aware of this development," one trader said.
"What the farmers care about are higher prices. It is still hard to predict what prices are going to be in the coming week," another trader said.
